title: The Father
creator: August Strindberg
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of The Father by August Strindberg, translated by Edith and Warner Oland. The Father is a naturalistic drama by Swedish playwright August Strindberg. The central conflict is between the Captain and his wife Laura about their daughter Bertha's future. In order to gain sole custody of her daughter, Laura tries to convince the Captain that he has gone mad. (Summary by Elizabeth Klett) Cast A Captain of Cavalry: Bob Neufeld Laura: Elizabeth Klett Bertha: Charlotte Duckett Dr. Ostermark: Algy Pug The Pastor: Bruce Pirie The Nurse: Arielle Lipshaw Nojd: Alan Mapstone An Orderly: David Warner Mother-in-Law: Sarah Parshall Narrator: Chuck Williamson Audio edited by Elizabeth Klett For more free audio books, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; audio; drama; play; strindberg; naturalism; gender roles
